tool.name: msort
tool.description: - sort tabular data by multiple fields
tool.command:
msort.py
## Inputs --infile=$infile
##Output --outfile=$outfile
## Check if using default or custom parameters --default_full_settings_type=$default_full_settings.settings_type #if $default_full_settings.settings_type == "full" --line_delimiters=$line_delimiters --num_lines_per_block=$num_lines_per_block --field_delimiters=$field_delimiters --reverse_sort=$reverse_sort --ignore_char_case=$ignore_char_case --treat_fields_as_num=$treat_fields_as_num --treat_fields_as_num_or_string=$treat_fields_as_num_or_string --sort_specified_fields=$sort_specified_fields #end if

param.name: settings_type
param.label: msort settings to use
param.help: For full control of this function, please use Full Parameter List

param.name: line_delimiters
param.label: Specify line delimiters used in input file

tool.help:
**What it does**
msort is a tool for sorting text files containing tabular data by rows.
-----
**How it works**
A notation is used for specifying fields to be sorted, e.g.:
rn10[2-6]: reverse sort rows 2-6 (include 6) of column 10, treat it as number n11: sort column 11, treat it as number f2[6-]: sort 6-end of column 2, treat it as string, ignore case rfm3: reverse sort column 3, treat it as string or number, ignore string case f3{red green blue}: sort column 3 , treat it as enum, ignore string case
-----
**Attribution**
Msort was written by Ruan Jue at BGI-SZ.
